patterns.name: Russian Tradecraft Transition
patterns.description: Shift from diplomatic cover to embedded bureaucratic insiders and proxies.
patterns.implication: Threat is epistemic corruption, not just document theft. Clearance vetting insufficient.

patterns.name: 24-Hour Zero-Day Weaponization
patterns.description: Disclosure to exploit to targeting in <24h. Cloud-native C2.

patterns.name: IPIDEA Takedown Friction
patterns.description: Removal of commodity anonymity leads to bespoke proxy meshes.
patterns.implication: Increases attribution clarity, not attacker weakness.

patterns.name: Iran-China Infra Lock-in
patterns.description: Permanent population segmentation via tiered access and full-stack surveillance.
patterns.implication: Need for non-IP-based comms for human rights monitoring.

patterns.name: Uranium Mobility Signaling
patterns.description: 400kg transfer discussion is about option preservation and leverage.

claims: Russian intelligence has completed transition to deep civilian embeds.
Zero-day exploitation is now industrialized CI/CD.
China is exporting authoritarian operating systems.
Iran is being structurally absorbed by Chinese digital infra.

assessments.text: Adversaries are optimizing for strategic optionality under detection pressure (Anti-fragile competition).
Normalization of a higher-tempo conflict environment. Russian intel is operationally ahead. Proxy disruption increases clarity.

actions: Shift CI from clearance-centric to behavior-centric.
Assume breach; optimize for containment velocity.
Prepare for proxy scarcity; invest in legal/diplomatic follow-through.
Prepare for post-IP Iran (RF mesh, satellite).
Expect Chinese surveillance export to scale.
